cards.name: Karn, Scion of Urza
cards.text:
+1: Reveal the top two cards of your library. An opponent chooses one of them. Put that card into your hand and exile the other with a silver counter on it.
−1: Put a card you own with a silver counter on it from exile into your hand.
−2: Create a 0/0 colorless Construct artifact creature token with "This creature gets +1/+1 for each artifact you control."

cards.flavor: The shield took a year to craft, a month to enchant, and a decade to master—all for one glorious moment.
cards.name: Adamant Will
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

cards.flavor: "My flock flew from a distant continent ruined by cataclysm and war. Benalia gave us shelter to end our exodus."
cards.name: Aven Sentry
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "The walls of Argive were built by a peaceful dynastic union that has guarded us against war for fifteen centuries. The lesson is clear."
cards.name: Baird, Steward of Argive
cards.text:
Vigilance
Creatures can't attack you or a planeswalker you control unless their controller pays {1} for each of those creatures.

cards.flavor:
"The true measure of all heroes is not what they achieve, but who they inspire."
—Triumph of Gerrard
cards.name: Benalish Honor Guard
cards.text: Benalish Honor Guard gets +1/+0 for each legendary creature you control.

cards.flavor:
"Some aspire to climb the mountain of Honor. The Benalish are born upon its peak, and from there ascend among the stars."
—History of Benalia
cards.name: Benalish Marshal
cards.text: Other creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: Enchanted by mage-smiths and blessed by priests, Benalish windows let in light and cast out darkness.
cards.name: Blessed Light
cards.text: Exile target creature or enchantment.

cards.flavor: A new gathering for a new age.
cards.name: Board the Weatherlight
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a historic card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: Benalish citizens born under the same constellations share a star-clan. Their loyalty to one another interlaces the Seven Houses.
cards.name: Call the Cavalry
cards.text: Create two 2/2 white Knight creature tokens with vigilance.

cards.flavor:
"Honor rides before us. All we have to do is catch up."
—Danitha Capashen
cards.name: Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Go swiftly, clever arrow, and teach
The philosophy of stillness."
—D'Avenant verse
cards.name: D'Avenant Trapper
cards.text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, tap target creature an opponent controls. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: "I will protect the less fortunate. I will love bravely. I will face despair and fight on. As a Capashen, I can do no less."
cards.name: Danitha Capashen, Paragon
cards.text:
First strike, vigilance, lifelink
Aura and Equipment spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.name: Daring Archaeologist
cards.text:
When Daring Archaeologist enters the battlefield, you may return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast a historic spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Daring Archaeologist. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: The Benalish aristocracy is hereditary, but the loyalty of its subjects is earned.
cards.name: Dauntless Bodyguard
cards.text:
As Dauntless Bodyguard enters the battlefield, choose another creature you control.
Sacrifice Dauntless Bodyguard: The chosen creature gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Rise, knight of New Benalia."
cards.name: Dub
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2, has first strike, and is a Knight in addition to its other types.

cards.flavor:
"Light from the Null Moon took form—a mirage made real, alone in grandeur, isolated in a world that once had been its own."
—Fall of the Thran
cards.name: Evra, Halcyon Witness
cards.text:
Lifelink
{4}: Exchange your life total with Evra, Halcyon Witness's power.

cards.name: Excavation Elephant
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} as you cast this spell.)
When Excavation Elephant enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Fall of the Thran
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I — Destroy all lands.
II, III — Each player returns two land cards from their graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: On Amonkhet, Gideon lost both his sural and his faith in himself. But he can still throw a punch, and he still knows a bad guy when he sees one.
cards.name: Gideon's Reproach
cards.text: Gideon's Reproach deals 4 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor:
"Whatever faith you have in Serra, she has more in you."
—Lyra Dawnbringer
cards.name: Healing Grace
cards.text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn by a source of your choice. You gain 3 life.

cards.name: History of Benalia
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.
III — Knights you control get +2/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Let go of all that harms you. Cast your burdens into the darkness, and build for the faithful a house of light."
—Song of All, canto 1008
cards.name: Invoke the Divine
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: A light to pierce the shadows.
cards.name: Knight of Grace
cards.text:
First strike
Hexproof from black (This creature can't be the target of black spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Knight of Grace gets +1/+0 as long as any player controls a black permanent.

cards.flavor: The mage-smiths of New Benalia have perfected the art of blending fine steel and enchanted glass into weapons that are both beautiful and deadly. Only elite knights are entrusted with these martial works of art.
cards.name: Knight of New Benalia

cards.flavor: Descendant of a vanished land, student of a forgotten general, and master of blades no smith could forge anew. He honors them all by living a life worthy of song.
cards.name: Kwende, Pride of Femeref
cards.text:
Double strike
Creatures you control with first strike have double strike.

cards.flavor: "You are not alone. You never were."
cards.name: Lyra Dawnbringer
cards.text:
Flying, first strike, lifelink
Other Angels you control get +1/+1 and have lifelink.

cards.flavor: The unicorns of Sursi are a manifestation of Serra's joy and compassion. They frolic and dance like children, offering blessings to anyone they encounter.
cards.name: Mesa Unicorn
cards.text: Lifelink

cards.flavor:
"The spirit of Serra raised Brindri high and commanded her to keep the balance."
—Song of All, canto 524
cards.name: On Serra's Wings
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is legendary, gets +1/+1, and has flying, vigilance, and lifelink.

cards.flavor: A pegasus chooses its rider, bearing the worthy into the clouds and tossing all others to the ground.
cards.name: Pegasus Courser
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Pegasus Courser attacks, another target attacking creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"When history becomes too mournful, even good souls may choose to forget."
—Shalai, voice of Plenty
cards.name: Sanctum Spirit
cards.text:
Lifelink
Discard a historic card: Sanctum Spirit gains indestructible until end of turn. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: An ancient nemesis rendered harmless long ago.
cards.name: Seal Away
cards.text:
Flash
When Seal Away enters the battlefield, exile target tapped creature an opponent controls until Seal Away leaves the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Knights get the glory. Soldiers get things done.
cards.name: Sergeant-at-Arms
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W} as you cast this spell.)
When Sergeant-at-Arms enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

cards.flavor: The angel remembers her past lives like dreams. Her song held up meadows. Her blade drove back darkness. Her wings carried her across the ages.
cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.flavor: Theologians now believe the Ancestor was another divine form of Serra.
cards.name: Serra Disciple
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
Whenever you cast a historic spell, Serra Disciple gets +1/+1 until end of turn. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.name: Shalai, Voice of Plenty
cards.text:
Flying
You, planeswalkers you control, and other creatures you control have hexproof.
{4}{G}{G}: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.

cards.flavor: "The Ancestor saved us for a purpose."
cards.name: Teshar, Ancestor's Apostle
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a historic spell, return target creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: "In a healing world I write—I, who will never be healed. Let my last gift be one of memory: from a thousand lost thoughts, choose one, and remember my name."
cards.name: Tragic Poet
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tragic Poet: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Triumph of Gerrard
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control with the greatest power.
III — Target creature you control with the greatest power gains flying, first strike, and lifelink until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Centuries ago, one man's vengeance plunged the world into ice and darkness.
cards.name: Urza's Ruinous Blast
cards.text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Exile all nonland permanents that aren't legendary.

cards.name: Academy Drake
cards.text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
If Academy Drake was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: "We don't choose who comes here. We choose how long they stay."
cards.name: Academy Journeymage
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control a Wizard.
When Academy Journeymage enters the battlefield, return target creature an opponent controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: The Antiquities War
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal an artifact card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
III — Artifacts you control become artifact creatures with base power and toughness 5/5 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The Tolarian Academies are known for their magical research, powerful sorcerers, and accidental destruction of ecosystems.
cards.name: Arcane Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flying.

cards.name: Artificer's Assistant
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a historic spell, scry 1. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic. To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.flavor:
"The trick to talking sense into Keldons is getting them to hold still. I learned that from Radha."
—Jhoira
cards.name: Befuddle
cards.text:
Target creature gets -4/-0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Blink of an Eye
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{U} as you cast this spell.)
Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. If this spell was kicked, draw a card.

cards.name: Cloudreader Sphinx
cards.text:
Flying
When Cloudreader Sphinx enters the battlefield, scry 2. (Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.flavor: For generations, the inhabitants of Orvada have hungered for turtle soup. For generations, the turtles have frustrated their ambitions.
cards.name: Cold-Water Snapper
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Curator's Ward
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent has hexproof.
When enchanted permanent leaves the battlefield, if it was historic, draw two cards. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: For cryomancers, studying the Ice Age isn't just an academic exercise.
cards.name: Deep Freeze
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has base power and toughness 0/4, has defender, loses all other abilities, and is a blue Wall in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.flavor: Archaeologists don't just dig in the dirt. They excavate time, scraping off the years grain by grain.
cards.name: Diligent Excavator
cards.text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor:
"Half your studies will be learning the laws of magic. The other half will be bending them."
—Naru Meha, master wizard
cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.

cards.flavor:
"Homarids spread northward from Sarpadia as the climate cooled, raiding coastal settlements for supplies."
—Time of Ice
cards.name: Homarid Explorer
cards.text: When Homarid Explorer enters the battlefield, target player puts the top four cards of their library into their graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Your contract is in default. You belong to me now. Serve, or die."
—Nicol Bolas
cards.name: In Bolas's Clutches
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
You control enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent is legendary.

cards.flavor: Centuries ago, a quest to harness time became a spiral into chaos.
cards.name: Karn's Temporal Sundering
cards.text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Target player takes an extra turn after this one. Return up to one target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Exile Karn's Temporal Sundering.

cards.flavor: Saved from destruction by one planeswalker's sacrifice, the Eliterate colony forswore the taking of life.
cards.name: Merfolk Trickster
cards.text:
Flash
When Merfolk Trickster enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. It loses all abilities until end of turn.

cards.name: The Mirari Conjecture
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I — Return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
II — Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
III — Until end of turn, whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: "Perfect. Now do it again."
cards.name: Naban, Dean of Iteration
cards.text: If a Wizard entering the battlefield under your control causes a triggered ability of a permanent you control to trigger, that ability triggers an additional time.

cards.name: Naru Meha, Master Wizard
cards.text:
Flash
When Naru Meha, Master Wizard enters the battlefield, copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. You may choose new targets for the copy.
Other Wizards you control get +1/+1.

cards.flavor: The crystal pulsed with the power of Teferi's planeswalker spark. Had Jhoira given him a blessing or a curse?
cards.name: Opt
cards.text:
Scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
Draw a card.

cards.name: Precognition Field
cards.text:
You may look at the top card of your library. (You may do this at any time.)
You may cast the top card of your library if it's an instant or sorcery card.
{3}: Exile the top card of your library.

cards.flavor: Her knack for tampering with wards got her kicked out of the academy, but they also got her back in.
cards.name: Relic Runner
cards.text: Relic Runner can't be blocked if you've cast a historic spell this turn. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: With just a few seconds to escape, Deryan saved Hurkyl's editions on restoring physical objects from ash.
cards.name: Rescue
cards.text: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: Though it was laid to waste by the brothers, many schools of magic trace their origins to the College of Lat-Nam, including the first Tolarian Academy.
cards.name: Sage of Lat-Nam
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Draw a card.

cards.name: Sentinel of the Pearl Trident
cards.text:
Flash
When Sentinel of the Pearl Trident enters the battlefield, you may exile target historic permanent you control. If you do, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.name: Slinn Voda, the Rising Deep
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{U} as you cast this spell.)
When Slinn Voda, the Rising Deep enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, return all creatures to their owners' hands except for Merfolk, Krakens, Leviathans, Octopuses, and Serpents.

cards.flavor: The fire spell stuttered and broke. Its pieces reached Teferi out of rhythm, meaningless.
cards.name: Syncopate
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.flavor: The first to arrive on Dominaria from their distant home, the marids are the oldest tribe of djinn and the most respected by storm and sea.
cards.name: Tempest Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
Tempest Djinn gets +1/+0 for each basic Island you control.

cards.flavor: "My ancestor Toshiro used to say, 'Life is a series of choices between bad and worse.' I'm a master of making great bad choices."
cards.name: Tetsuko Umezawa, Fugitive
cards.text: Creatures you control with power or toughness 1 or less can't be blocked.

cards.name: Time of Ice
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Tap target creature an opponent controls. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Time of Ice.
III — Return all tapped creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor: The Tolarian Academies embrace a tradition of study and research while discouraging the kinds of experiments that ruined the original island of Tolaria.
cards.name: Tolarian Scholar

cards.flavor:
"A problem is only a problem if you don't have the tools to correct it."
—Jhoira
cards.name: Unwind
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell. Untap up to three lands.

cards.flavor: The Vodalian Empire tends to be insular. The scholarly Volshe caste are the exception, using education as an antidote to xenophobia.
cards.name: Vodalian Arcanist
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. Spend this mana only to cast an instant or sorcery spell.

cards.flavor: In lives that have stretched for centuries, there are bound to be a few awkward silences.
cards.name: Weight of Memory
cards.text: Draw three cards. Target player puts the top three cards of their library into their graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"The second mage learned to dissipate blasts of lightning. Threat and response: thus did the study of magic progress."
—Naban, dean of iteration
cards.name: Wizard's Retort
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast if you control a Wizard.
Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: "I do as I please, little mortal. Do go on about your wishes, though—they amuse me to no end."
cards.name: Zahid, Djinn of the Lamp
cards.text:
You may pay {3}{U} and tap an untapped artifact you control rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Flying

cards.flavor:
"My heart is not mine, it is Belzenlok's. All hearts are his, and all blood."
—"Rite of Belzenlok"
cards.name: Blessing of Belzenlok
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+1 until end of turn. If it's legendary, it also gains lifelink until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "All hail the Demonlord Belzenlok, Evincar of the Stronghold, Scion of Darkness, Doom of Fools, Lord of the Wastes, Master of the Ebon Hand, Eternal Patriarch of the Cabal . . ."
cards.name: Cabal Evangel

cards.flavor:
"The Demonlord has ruled every age. Every ruin, myth, and nightmare proves his power."
—"Rite of Belzenlok"
cards.name: Cabal Paladin
cards.text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, Cabal Paladin deals 2 damage to each opponent. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: "Take their faces. The lips of these unbelievers may yet honor the Demonlord."
cards.name: Caligo Skin-Witch
cards.text:
Kicker {3}{B} (You may pay an additional {3}{B} as you cast this spell.)
When Caligo Skin-Witch enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, each opponent discards two cards.

cards.flavor:
"Your life is finished, your name lost, and your work forgotten. It is as though Mazeura never existed."
—Chainer's Torment
cards.name: Cast Down
cards.text: Destroy target nonlegendary creature.

cards.name: Chainer's Torment
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Chainer's Torment deals 2 damage to each opponent and you gain 2 life.
III — Create an X/X black Nightmare Horror creature token, where X is half your life total, rounded up. It deals X damage to you.

cards.flavor: "I have pustules of the great Ratadrabik, very cheap. No? Surely you'll want a tincture of Nevinyrral's pulverized remains. Genuine!"
cards.name: Dark Bargain
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard. Dark Bargain deals 2 damage to you.

cards.flavor:
"Nature is not always gentle or kind, but all life begets life."
—Marwyn of Llanowar
cards.name: Deathbloom Thallid
cards.text: When Deathbloom Thallid dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.flavor: In the Cabal, death is just another mark of devotion.
cards.name: Demonic Vigor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
When enchanted creature dies, return that card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Demonlord Belzenlok
cards.text:
Flying, trample
When Demonlord Belzenlok enters the battlefield, exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card, then put that card into your hand. If the card's converted mana cost is 4 or greater, repeat this process. Demonlord Belzenlok deals 1 damage to you for each card put into your hand this way.

cards.flavor: Flittersprites collect unusually valuable things: coins of fallen empires, baby teeth, and memories of treasured names.
cards.name: Divest
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose an artifact or creature card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.flavor:
"The forest surrounding the Vess estate became the Caligo Morass, a vast bog stalked by horrors too terrible to name."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"
cards.name: Dread Shade
cards.text: {B}: Dread Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
The Cabal assured the Seven Houses
that hostages receive all the food and
rest they require.
cards.name: Drudge Sentinel
cards.text: {3}: Tap Drudge Sentinel. It gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

cards.name: The Eldest Reborn
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I — Each opponent sacrifices a creature or planeswalker.
II — Each opponent discards a card.
III — Put target creature or planeswalker card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor:
"Fear the dark if you must, but don't mistake sunlight for safety."
—Josu Vess
cards.name: Eviscerate
cards.text: Destroy target creature.

cards.flavor:
"Urborg used to be lovely—scenic volcanoes, respectable lich lords. Since the Cabal came with their nightmares and thrulls, it's all gone to the worms."
—Mister Lostspoons, Skulltown gossip
cards.name: Feral Abomination
cards.text: Deathtouch

cards.flavor:
"Sleep now, brother. That is the one gift I can give you."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Final Parting
cards.text: Search your library for two cards. Put one into your hand and the other into your graveyard. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: To thallids, the whole world is just a pile of mulch to grow saprolings in.
cards.name: Fungal Infection
cards.text: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.name: Josu Vess, Lich Knight
cards.text:
Kicker {5}{B} (You may pay an additional {5}{B} as you cast this spell.)
Menace
When Josu Vess, Lich Knight enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, create eight 2/2 black Zombie Knight creature tokens with menace.

cards.name: Kazarov, Sengir Pureblood
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a creature an opponent controls is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on Kazarov, Sengir Pureblood.
{3}{R}: Kazarov deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: A shadow to swallow the light.
cards.name: Knight of Malice
cards.text:
First strike
Hexproof from white (This creature can't be the target of white spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Knight of Malice gets +1/+0 as long as any player controls a white permanent.

cards.name: Lich's Mastery
cards.text:
Hexproof
You can't lose the game.
Whenever you gain life, draw that many cards.
Whenever you lose life, for each 1 life you lost, exile a permanent you control or a card from your hand or graveyard.
When Lich's Mastery leaves the battlefield, you lose the game.

cards.flavor:
"True power never dies, but lies awake, waiting for its name to be spoken."
—The Eldest Reborn
cards.name: Lingering Phantom
cards.text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, you may pay {B}. If you do, return Lingering Phantom from your graveyard to your hand. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Scriptures
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I — Put a +1/+1 counter on up to one target creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.
II — Destroy all nonartifact creatures.
III — Exile all cards from all opponents' graveyards.

cards.flavor: Wreckage from the Phyrexian Invasion provided the rats with a seemingly unlimited number of breeding grounds.
cards.name: Rat Colony
cards.text:
Rat Colony gets +1/+0 for each other Rat you control.
A deck can have any number of cards named Rat Colony.

cards.name: Rite of Belzenlok
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Create two 0/1 black Cleric creature tokens.
III — Create a 6/6 black Demon creature token with flying, trample, and "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice another creature. If you can't, this creature deals 6 damage to you."

cards.flavor:
"You bound me with a contract only your death could end—and you thought me the fool?"
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Settle the Score
cards.text: Exile target creature. Put two loyalty counters on a planeswalker you control.

cards.flavor: The first mistake the Grimnant knights made was bullying the owner of an Urborg corpse shop. Their second mistake was dying.
cards.name: Soul Salvage
cards.text: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Stronghold Confessor
cards.text:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
If Stronghold Confessor was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: Thelon of Havenwood created thallids as a food source in times of darkness. Thallids did the same with saprolings.
cards.name: Thallid Omnivore
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice another creature: Thallid Omnivore gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If a Saproling was sacrificed this way, you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: Some of the thallids that escaped into the fens of Urborg began emulating the Cabal's bloodsoaked rituals in their own peculiar way.
cards.name: Thallid Soothsayer
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

cards.name: Torgaar, Famine Incarnate
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, you may sacrifice any number of creatures. This spell costs {2} less to cast for each creature sacrificed this way.
When Torgaar, Famine Incarnate enters the battlefield, up to one target player's life total becomes half their starting life total, rounded down.

cards.flavor: As the phantom flies overhead, the city of Vhelnish screams in silence.
cards.name: Urgoros, the Empty One
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Urgoros, the Empty One deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card at random. If the player can't, you draw a card.

cards.name: Vicious Offering
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice a creature. (You may sacrifice a creature in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. If this spell was kicked, that creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn instead.

cards.flavor: "Look how they beg for the knife! The Demonlord has trained them well."
cards.name: Whisper, Blood Liturgist
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice two creatures: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Acolytes of the lost Lord Windgrace fight to keep Urborg relics out of Cabal hands.
cards.name: Windgrace Acolyte
cards.text:
Flying
When Windgrace Acolyte enters the battlefield, put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard and you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: When Belzenlok's lieutenant Yar-Kul grew too ambitious, the Demonlord transformed him into a maggot. The frog that ate the maggot grew and grew, until a ravenous spirit burst from its body.
cards.name: Yargle, Glutton of Urborg

cards.flavor: Centuries ago, a mad god offered a simple trade.
cards.name: Yawgmoth's Vile Offering
cards.text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Put up to one target creature or planeswalker card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. Destroy up to one target creature or planeswalker. Exile Yawgmoth's Vile Offering.

cards.flavor: The stone whispers tales of darkness and fire. She replies, "Tell me more."
cards.name: Bloodstone Goblin
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, if that spell was kicked, Bloodstone Goblin gets +1/+1 and gains menace until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.flavor: Grand Warlord Radha's challengers are always defeated, but she rewards the most passionate with the Flame of Keld. After that, they burn for her.
cards.name: Champion of the Flame
cards.text:
Trample
Champion of the Flame gets +2/+2 for each Aura and Equipment attached to it.

cards.flavor:
"The flame paints a bright wheel on the sky, then shifts into a stabbing spark. The enemy falls; the smoke of victory rises."
—"Legends of the Firedancer"
cards.name: Fervent Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike and haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Burning something is easy. Choosing a target can be more difficult.
cards.name: Fiery Intervention
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Fiery Intervention deals 5 damage to target creature.
• Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Fight with Fire
cards.text:
Kicker {5}{R} (You may pay an additional {5}{R} as you cast this spell.)
Fight with Fire deals 5 damage to target creature. If this spell was kicked, it deals 10 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets instead. (Those targets can include players and planeswalkers.)

cards.flavor:
"The best way to learn from a book on pyromancy is to burn it."
—Jaya Ballard
cards.name: Fire Elemental

cards.flavor: The versatile "fiery gauntlet" is among the first spells young Ghitu mages learn.
cards.name: Firefist Adept
cards.text: When Firefist Adept enters the battlefield, it deals X damage to target creature an opponent controls, where X is the number of Wizards you control.

cards.name: The First Eruption
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I — The First Eruption deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
II — Add {R}{R}.
III — Sacrifice a Mountain. If you do, The First Eruption deals 3 damage to each creature.

cards.name: The Flame of Keld
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I — Discard your hand.
II — Draw two cards.
III — If a red source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player this turn, it deals that much damage plus 2 to that permanent or player instead.

cards.flavor:
"The heat in our hearts sometimes rises to the surface."
—Valduk, keeper of the Flame
cards.name: Frenzied Rage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1 and has menace. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)

cards.flavor: "What fire forged, fire remembers."
cards.name: Ghitu Chronicler
cards.text:
Kicker {3}{R} (You may pay an additional {3}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Ghitu Chronicler enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The Ghitu of Shiv are as fierce and uncompromising as their volcanic home.
cards.name: Ghitu Journeymage
cards.text: When Ghitu Journeymage enters the battlefield, if you control another Wizard, Ghitu Journeymage deals 2 damage to each opponent.

cards.flavor: Tolarians teach the theory of pyromancy. The Ghitu prefer applied research.
cards.name: Ghitu Lavarunner
cards.text: As long as there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, Ghitu Lavarunner gets +1/+0 and has haste.

cards.name: Goblin Barrage
cards.text:
Kicker—Sacrifice an artifact or Goblin. (You may sacrifice an artifact or Goblin in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)
Goblin Barrage deals 4 damage to target creature. If this spell was kicked, it also deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.flavor: "The trick is, once you get moving, don't stop!"
cards.name: Goblin Chainwhirler
cards.text:
First strike
When Goblin Chainwhirler enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each opponent and each creature and planeswalker they control.

cards.flavor: Not since the days of Pashalik Mons have the Rundvelt goblins been so united or effective.
cards.name: Goblin Warchief
cards.text:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblins you control have haste.

cards.name: Haphazard Bombardment
cards.text:
When Haphazard Bombardment enters the battlefield, choose four nonenchantment permanents you don't control and put an aim counter on each of them.
At the beginning of your end step, if two or more permanents you don't control have an aim counter on them, destroy one of those permanents at random.

cards.name: Jaya Ballard
cards.text:
+1: Add {R}{R}{R}. Spend this mana only to cast instant or sorcery spells.
+1: Discard up to three cards, then draw that many cards.
−8: You get an emblem with "You may cast instant and sorcery cards from your graveyard. If a card cast this way would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead."

cards.flavor: Centuries ago, a pyromancer's spark ignited a fiery conflagration.
cards.name: Jaya's Immolating Inferno
cards.text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Jaya's Immolating Inferno deals X damage to each of up to three targets.

cards.name: Keldon Overseer
cards.text:
Kicker {3}{R} (You may pay an additional {3}{R} as you cast this spell.)
Haste
When Keldon Overseer enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Keldon raiders' spoils are limited to what their colos can carry. No matter the value, the rest goes up in smoke.
cards.name: Keldon Raider
cards.text: When Keldon Raider enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"The Mountain gave the Flame to Kradak to light the furnaces of his people's hearts. The wanderers became Keldons, and he the first warlord."
—"The Flame of Keld"
cards.name: Keldon Warcaller
cards.text: Whenever Keldon Warcaller attacks, put a lore counter on target Saga you control.

cards.flavor: Every ancient relic is a weapon if you throw it hard enough.
cards.name: Orcish Vandal
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Orcish Vandal deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: As the Cabal legions pushed into Shiv, they learned not to stand so close together.
cards.name: Radiating Lightning
cards.text: Radiating Lightning deals 3 damage to target player and 1 damage to each creature that player controls.

cards.flavor: Keldon warriors take advantage of the cyclops's inability to focus on more than one thing at a time.
cards.name: Rampaging Cyclops
cards.text: Rampaging Cyclops gets -2/-0 as long as two or more creatures are blocking it.

cards.flavor: Keld faced an apocalypse to fulfill a dire prophecy. Now Keldons have nothing left to believe in except themselves.
cards.name: Run Amok
cards.text: Target attacking creature gets +3/+3 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Shiv is a restless land. It heaves ash, bleeds lava, and scabs over in black obsidian."
—The First Eruption
cards.name: Seismic Shift
cards.text: Destroy target land. Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: Sometimes Shivan dragons toy with their food. Other times they just cook it.
cards.name: Shivan Fire
cards.text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Shivan Fire deals 2 damage to target creature. If this spell was kicked, it deals 4 damage to that creature instead.

cards.flavor: "Ready . . . uh . . . fire!"
cards.name: Siege-Gang Commander
cards.text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, create three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: Deep beneath the ruined continent of Otaria, there's a mine where goblins still work, ignorant of the destruction above.
cards.name: Skirk Prospector
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R}.

cards.flavor: It skitters across Shiv, each tendril hitting the ground with a sharp snap.
cards.name: Skizzik
cards.text:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, if Skizzik wasn't kicked, sacrifice it.

cards.flavor: "You gotta be pretty smart to live long as me, but not being able to die helps."
cards.name: Squee, the Immortal
cards.text: You may cast Squee, the Immortal from your graveyard or from exile.

cards.flavor: He watches the pass in both directions, and all must pay his toll.
cards.name: Two-Headed Giant
cards.text: Whenever Two-Headed Giant attacks, flip two coins. If both coins come up heads, Two-Headed Giant gains double strike until end of turn. If both coins come up tails, Two-Headed Giant gains menace until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The hammer strikes. The Flame awakens.
cards.name: Valduk, Keeper of the Flame
cards.text: At the beginning of combat on your turn, for each Aura and Equipment attached to Valduk, Keeper of the Flame, create a 3/1 red Elemental creature token with trample and haste. Exile those tokens at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Verix Bladewing
cards.text:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Verix Bladewing enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, create Karox Bladewing, a legendary 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying.

cards.flavor: War begins with one red ember.
cards.name: Warcry Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Whenever you attack with three or more creatures, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, return Warcry Phoenix from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped and attacking.

cards.flavor:
"The old ways were for a winter world. We do what's best for us, not for the past. We are Keldons!"
—Grand Warlord Radha
cards.name: Warlord's Fury
cards.text:
Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"The study of magic began when the first mage taught herself to throw lightning."
—Naban, dean of iteration
cards.name: Wizard's Lightning
cards.text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if you control a Wizard.
Wizard's Lightning deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: Every odyssey begins with a single step.
cards.name: Adventurous Impulse
cards.text: Look at the top three cards of your library. You may reveal a creature or land card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: Multani's mind grasped for consciousness as rage itself rebuilt his body.
cards.name: Ancient Animus
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control if it's legendary. Then it fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor:
"Llanowar's boughs are ever ready
To unleash an autumn of steel leaves."
—"Song of Freyalise"
cards.name: Arbor Armament
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. That creature gains reach until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A baloth only cares about the many things it eats and the few things that eat it.
cards.name: Baloth Gorger
cards.text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
If Baloth Gorger was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: "I can't bear to see another plane broken before I make my own home whole. I'm sorry, but my watch is over."
cards.name: Broken Bond
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Nothing tastes finer to an ooze than a priceless family heirloom.
cards.name: Corrosive Ooze
cards.text: Whenever Corrosive Ooze blocks or becomes blocked by an equipped creature, destroy all Equipment attached to that creature at end of combat.

cards.flavor: The bond between Llanowar elves and their kavu empowers both.
cards.name: Elfhame Druid
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Add {G}{G}. Spend this mana only to cast kicked spells.

cards.flavor: Thallids nurture saprolings, entertain them, and eat them.
cards.name: Fungal Plots
cards.text:
{1}{G}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Sacrifice two Saprolings: You gain 2 life and draw a card.

cards.name: Gaea's Blessing
cards.text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from their graveyard into their library.
Draw a card.
When Gaea's Blessing is put into your graveyard from your library, shuffle your graveyard into your library.

cards.flavor: Fallen Phyrexians were transmuted into elementals by Gaea long ago, but Yavimaya's other inhabitants still regard them with unease.
cards.name: Gaea's Protector
cards.text: Gaea's Protector must be blocked if able.

cards.name: Gift of Growth
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Untap target creature. It gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If this spell was kicked, that creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn instead.

cards.name: Grow from the Ashes
cards.text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library. If this spell was kicked, instead search your library for two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Grunn, the Lonely King
cards.text:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
If Grunn, the Lonely King was kicked, it enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.
Whenever Grunn attacks alone, double its power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Centuries ago, a barbarian laid his rage to rest.
cards.name: Kamahl's Druidic Vow
cards.text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Look at the top X cards of your library. You may put any number of land and/or legendary permanent cards with converted mana cost X or less from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: "Druids endure disaster as seeds endure winter. Now Krosa blooms once more."
cards.name: Krosan Druid
cards.text:
Kicker {4}{G} (You may pay an additional {4}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Krosan Druid enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, you gain 10 life.

cards.flavor: As patient and generous as life, as harsh and merciless as nature.
cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.

cards.flavor:
"Cherish this world in honor of the martyrs who saved it. We too must be prepared to give our lives."
—The Mending of Dominaria
cards.name: Llanowar Envoy
cards.text: {1}{G}: Add one mana of any color.

cards.flavor: Llanowar elfhames occupy different heights within the great forest. Elves of the Loridalh and Kelfae hames can see neither earth nor sky.
cards.name: Llanowar Scout
cards.text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Most spiders of Llanowar disdain elvish alliances. No elf has as many beautiful eyes or as many strong arms.
cards.name: Mammoth Spider
cards.text: Reach

cards.flavor: Midwife to mothers and leader to all.
cards.name: Marwyn, the Nurturer
cards.text:
Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Marwyn, the Nurturer.
{T}: Add an amount of {G} equal to Marwyn's power.

cards.name: The Mending of Dominaria
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard, then you may return a creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
III — Return all land cards from your graveyard to the battlefield, then shuffle your graveyard into your library.

cards.name: Multani, Yavimaya's Avatar
cards.text:
Reach, trample
Multani, Yavimaya's Avatar gets +1/+1 for each land you control and each land card in your graveyard.
{1}{G}, Return two lands you control to their owner's hand: Return Multani from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"As Argoth's last defenders fell to Urza's juggernauts, Titania said, 'Nature cannot be destroyed, only changed.'"
—The Antiquities War
cards.name: Nature's Spiral
cards.text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Llanowar elves conceal their ballistae in the upper canopy of the forest, ready to clear the skies of any intruder.
cards.name: Pierce the Sky
cards.text: Pierce the Sky deals 7 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.flavor:
"You can hear its tail thrashing from a mile away. Keep in mind that its jaws may already be half a mile closer."
—Jenson Carthalion, Yavimaya exile
cards.name: Primordial Wurm

cards.flavor: Thallids herd saprolings from place to place in search of detritus to feed them.
cards.name: Saproling Migration
cards.text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Create two 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens. If this spell was kicked, create four of those tokens instead.

cards.name: Song of Freyalise
cards.text:
(As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)
I, II — Until your next turn, creatures you control gain "{T}: Add one mana of any color."
III — Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Those creatures gain vigilance, trample, and indestructible until end of turn.

cards.flavor: As the irrepressible power of a dormant Multani courses through Yavimaya, the forest passes judgment on travelers and natives alike. Only the fungus prospers.
cards.name: Spore Swarm
cards.text: Create three 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens.

cards.flavor:
"The identifying ornamental growths of alpha thallids may be hereditary, or catalyzed by some chemical signal."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III
cards.name: Sporecrown Thallid
cards.text: Each other creature you control that's a Fungus or Saproling gets +1/+1.

cards.flavor: One eye open to see the truth of the world. One eye covered to gaze at the goddess within.
cards.name: Steel Leaf Champion
cards.text: Steel Leaf Champion can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.

cards.flavor:
"Yavimaya is aware, but not always awake. You will know the difference when you see it."
—Karn
cards.name: Sylvan Awakening
cards.text: Until your next turn, all lands you control become 2/2 Elemental creatures with reach, indestructible, and haste. They're still lands.

cards.flavor: A living remnant of the Ice Age.
cards.name: Territorial Allosaurus
cards.text:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Territorial Allosaurus enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, it fights another target creature.

cards.flavor: The first law of Yavimaya is that guests may kill only to survive. As fires aren't needed in the warm weather, cutting trees for wood means death.
cards.name: Thorn Elemental
cards.text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Untamed Kavu
cards.text:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
Vigilance, trample
If Untamed Kavu was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: The bower shuddered. The stillness broke. The scurf shifted, and a being emerged from the flowers and ferns.
cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.name: Wild Onslaught
cards.text:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. If this spell was kicked, put two +1/+1 counters on each creature you control instead.

cards.flavor:
"When their community grows cluttered, thallids begin a traditional bobbing dance, then trek out in all directions."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. III
cards.name: Yavimaya Sapherd
cards.text: When Yavimaya Sapherd enters the battlefield, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.flavor: The passionate intensity of the Ghitu tempered by the cool insight of Tolarian training.
cards.name: Adeliz, the Cinder Wind
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Wizards you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "I won't abandon the Weatherlight. My destiny is to serve at Jhoira's side. This 'illness' means I must trust my faith more and myself less."
cards.name: Arvad the Cursed
cards.text:
Deathtouch, lifelink
Other legendary creatures you control get +2/+2.

cards.name: Aryel, Knight of Windgrace
cards.text:
Vigilance
{2}{W}, {T}: Create a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance.
{B}, {T}, Tap X untapped Knights you control: Destroy target creature with power X or less.

cards.name: Darigaaz Reincarnated
cards.text:
Flying, trample, haste
If Darigaaz Reincarnated would die, instead exile it with three egg counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Darigaaz is exiled with an egg counter on it, remove an egg counter from it. Then if Darigaaz has no egg counters on it, return it to the battlefield.

cards.name: Garna, the Bloodflame
cards.text:
Flash
When Garna, the Bloodflame enters the battlefield, return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from anywhere this turn.
Other creatures you control have haste.

cards.flavor: "The future is my gift to Keld."
cards.name: Grand Warlord Radha
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever one or more creatures you control attack, add that much mana in any combination of {R} and/or {G}. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as steps and phases end.

cards.name: Hallar, the Firefletcher
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever you cast a spell, if that spell was kicked, put a +1/+1 counter on Hallar, the Firefletcher, then Hallar deals damage equal to the number of +1/+1 counters on it to each opponent.

cards.flavor: As she took the wheel of the Weatherlight for the first time in a millennium, Jhoira knew she'd been right to restore the ship. Anything was possible now.
cards.name: Jhoira, Weatherlight Captain
cards.text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, draw a card. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor:
"Chronicles across the ages describe Jodah. They likely refer not to one mage, but to a family or an arcane title."
—Arkol, Argivian scholar
cards.name: Jodah, Archmage Eternal
cards.text:
Flying
You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay the mana cost for spells that you cast.

cards.flavor:
"My child grew from rot and ruin, yet she bloomed."
—Multani
cards.name: Muldrotha, the Gravetide
cards.text: During each of your turns, you may play up to one permanent card of each permanent type from your graveyard. (If a card has multiple permanent types, choose one as you play it.)

cards.flavor: "For the lost and forgotten, I will keep watch."
cards.name: Oath of Teferi
cards.text:
When Oath of Teferi enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent you control. Return it to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
You may activate the loyalty abilities of planeswalkers you control twice each turn rather than only once.

cards.flavor: Centuries ago, five dragons conquered death to rule the living.
cards.name: Primevals' Glorious Rebirth
cards.text:
(You may cast a legendary sorcery only if you control a legendary creature or planeswalker.)
Return all legendary permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Raff Capashen, Ship's Mage
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
You may cast historic spells as though they had flash. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.name: Rona, Disciple of Gix
cards.text:
When Rona, Disciple of Gix enters the battlefield, you may exile target historic card from your graveyard. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
You may cast nonland cards exiled with Rona.
{4}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library.

cards.flavor: "I am heir to many treasures. None is as precious as knowing how my ancestor lived her life."
cards.name: Shanna, Sisay's Legacy
cards.text:
Shanna, Sisay's Legacy can't be the target of abilities your opponents control.
Shanna gets +1/+1 for each creature you control.

cards.flavor: As Jhoira restored the Weatherlight, a mushroom growing in its hold unexpectedly became her first crew member.
cards.name: Slimefoot, the Stowaway
cards.text:
Whenever a Saproling you control dies, Slimefoot, the Stowaway deals 1 damage to each opponent and you gain 1 life.
{4}: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

cards.flavor: "Yavimaya is one being—one vastness of rippling leaves, one deepness of roots, and one chatter of animals—of which I am one part."
cards.name: Tatyova, Benthic Druid
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life and draw a card.

cards.name: Teferi, Hero of Dominaria
cards.text:
+1: Draw a card. At the beginning of the next end step, untap two lands.
−3: Put target nonland permanent into its owner's library third from the top.
−8: You get an emblem with "Whenever you draw a card, exile target permanent an opponent controls."

cards.flavor: "Nothing is too broken to mend."
cards.name: Tiana, Ship's Caretaker
cards.text:
Flying, first strike
Whenever an Aura or Equipment you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may return that card to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: An ancient device recovered from a thawing glacier high in the Karplusan mountains.
cards.name: Aesthir Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Aesthir Glider can't block.

cards.flavor: Neither its appearance nor its temperature varies as the years pass, an eternal testament to the forces that shaped Dominaria.
cards.name: Amaranthine Wall
cards.text:
Defender
{2}: Amaranthine Wall gains indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it.)

cards.flavor: It spilled the blood of one elder dragon. In Gideon's hands, it may yet taste another's.
cards.name: Blackblade Reforged

cards.flavor:
"Bring me an angel feather, and I will give you one death in return. There can be no turning back once the candle is lit."
—Whisper, blood liturgist
cards.name: Bloodtallow Candle
cards.text: {6}, {T}, Sacrifice Bloodtallow Candle: Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A Thran relic, it has spent ten thousand years doing absolutely nothing.
cards.name: Damping Sphere
cards.text:
If a land is tapped for two or more mana, it produces {C} instead of any other type and amount.
Each spell a player casts costs {1} more to cast for each other spell that player has cast this turn.

cards.name: Forebear's Blade

cards.flavor:
"The perfection of the lotus reminds me of my hopes for this world . . . and my failures. I will not rest until I've atoned for them."
—Karn
cards.name: Gilded Lotus
cards.text: {T}: Add three mana of any one color.

cards.flavor: Archaeologists depend on automatons inspired by their previous discoveries at Koilos to guard the excavations.
cards.name: Guardians of Koilos
cards.text: When Guardians of Koilos enters the battlefield, you may return another target historic permanent you control to its owner's hand. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: Forged out of flowstone for the queen of Vesuva.
cards.name: Helm of the Host
cards.text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, create a token that's a copy of equipped creature, except the token isn't legendary if equipped creature is legendary. That token gains haste.
Equip {5}

cards.flavor: It wails of buried riches and the souls lost seeking them.
cards.name: Howling Golem
cards.text: Whenever Howling Golem attacks or blocks, each player draws a card.

cards.flavor: Ice may thaw, but malice never does.
cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.flavor:
"You could say it was my pet project."
—Jhoira
cards.name: Jhoira's Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
Historic spells you cast cost {1} less to cast. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.name: Jousting Lance
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0.
As long as it's your turn, equipped creature has first strike.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
"Urza's machines have a splendid habit of excavating themselves."
—Rona, disciple of Gix
cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.flavor: It has witnessed history's most significant events, one incarnation after another.
cards.name: Mishra's Self-Replicator
cards.text: Whenever you cast a historic spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, create a token that's a copy of Mishra's Self-Replicator. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: A moment in time made tangible, it has the power to realize epic visions.
cards.name: Mox Amber
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color among legendary creatures and planeswalkers you control.

cards.flavor: The Weatherlight can no longer planeshift, but it can traverse Dominaria with ease.
cards.name: Navigator's Compass
cards.text:
When Navigator's Compass enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
{T}: Until end of turn, target land you control becomes the basic land type of your choice in addition to its other types.

cards.flavor:
"To the head of Archaeological Findings: The excavation schedule at dig site 93-beta must be revised. Part of the site has walked off."
—Tolarian field dispatch
cards.name: Pardic Wanderer
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor:
"Light passing through a powerstone is refracted by eternity and colored by planar energy. I wonder how the world appeared through Urza's eyes?"
—Teferi
cards.name: Powerstone Shard
cards.text: {T}: Add {C} for each artifact you control named Powerstone Shard.

cards.flavor: Benalish glazeplate is stained with salts from the Rift Era and enchanted to deflect blows.
cards.name: Shield of the Realm
cards.text:
If a source would deal damage to equipped creature, prevent 2 of that damage.
Equip {1}

cards.flavor:
"Sometimes the only difference between a martyr and a hero is a sword."
—Captain Sisay, Memoirs
cards.name: Short Sword
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Like a cross between a spider and a spyglass, but friendlier.
cards.name: Skittering Surveyor
cards.text: When Skittering Surveyor enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Sorcerer's Wand
cards.text:
Equipped creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker. If this creature is a Wizard, it deals 2 damage to that player or planeswalker instead."
Equip {3}

cards.flavor: The trainers were a gift of gratitude from the wizards of Tolaria West to the knights of New Benalia for their aid during the Talas Incursion.
cards.name: Sparring Construct
cards.text: When Sparring Construct dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

cards.flavor: The portal opens not to the past, but from it. Those who step through discover an unimaginable future.
cards.name: Thran Temporal Gateway
cards.text: {4}, {T}: You may put a historic permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.name: Traxos, Scourge of Kroog
cards.text:
Trample
Traxos, Scourge of Kroog enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a historic spell, untap Traxos. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor:
"Truly understanding even one volume can be a life's work."
—Naru Meha, master wizard
cards.name: Urza's Tome
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Draw a card. Then discard a card unless you exile a historic card from your graveyard. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)

cards.flavor: A missing piece in search of a puzzle.
cards.name: Voltaic Servant
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, untap target artifact.

cards.name: Weatherlight
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Weatherlight deals combat damage to a player, look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a historic card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. (Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)
Crew 3

cards.flavor: The seat of Belzenlok's power, the Stronghold serves as the gathering place for the Cabal as their dark influence spreads from Urborg.
cards.name: Cabal Stronghold
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}, {T}: Add {B} for each basic Swamp you control.

cards.flavor: The sunlight falls pristine on the temple at Epityr, softened by the remembered shadows of angelic saviors' wings.
cards.name: Clifftop Retreat
cards.text:
Clifftop Retreat enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Plains.
{T}: Add {R} or {W}.

cards.flavor:
"Our ancestors brought down a Phyrexian portal ship, then built our town on its hull. We're pretty proud of that."
—Alene of Riverspan
cards.name: Hinterland Harbor
cards.text:
Hinterland Harbor enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Forest or an Island.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}.

cards.flavor: Serra's blessing lies strongest upon Sursi, where her holy chapels are untouched even as the Cabal encroaches.
cards.name: Isolated Chapel
cards.text:
Isolated Chapel enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.

cards.name: Memorial to Folly
cards.text:
Memorial to Folly enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
{2}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Memorial to Folly: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Memorial to Genius
cards.text:
Memorial to Genius enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}.
{4}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice Memorial to Genius: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Memorial to Glory
cards.text:
Memorial to Glory enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}.
{3}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Memorial to Glory: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

cards.name: Memorial to Unity
cards.text:
Memorial to Unity enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{2}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Memorial to Unity: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Then put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

cards.name: Memorial to War
cards.text:
Memorial to War enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
{4}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Memorial to War: Destroy target land.

cards.flavor:
"We have inherited the mysteries of the Thran, but few of the answers."
—Jhoira
cards.name: Sulfur Falls
cards.text:
Sulfur Falls enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an Island or a Mountain.
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.

cards.flavor:
"They never found the body of young Josu, or that of his murderous sister."
—"The Fall of the House of Vess"
cards.name: Woodland Cemetery
cards.text:
Woodland Cemetery enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Swamp or a Forest.
{T}: Add {B} or {G}.

cards.flavor:
"The wind whispers, 'come home,' but I cannot."
—Teferi
cards.name: Zhalfirin Void
cards.text:
When Zhalfirin Void enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {C}.

cards.name: Teferi, Timebender
cards.text:
+2: Untap up to one target artifact or creature.
−3: You gain 2 life and draw two cards.
−9: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.flavor: The Cabal soldier blinked and found day had become night, he had a face full of thistle seeds, and the old man was nowhere to be seen.
cards.name: Temporal Machinations
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. If you control an artifact, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "My father will be happy to see you."
cards.name: Niambi, Faithful Healer
cards.text: When Niambi, Faithful Healer enters the battlefield, you may search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Teferi, Timebender, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

cards.flavor:
"Long ago, I enchanted an army of statues to guard Zhalfir. My homeland is gone, but its protectors remain."
—Teferi
cards.name: Teferi's Sentinel
cards.text: As long as you control a Teferi planeswalker, Teferi's Sentinel gets +4/+0.

cards.flavor:
"Everywhere you look, this world is healing from its wounds. Aren't you ready to do the same?"
—Jhoira, to Teferi
cards.name: Meandering River
cards.text:
Meandering River enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.

cards.name: Chandra, Bold Pyromancer
cards.text:
+1: Add {R}{R}. Chandra, Bold Pyromancer deals 2 damage to target player.
−3: Chandra, Bold Pyromancer deals 3 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
−7: Chandra, Bold Pyromancer deals 10 damage to target player and each creature and planeswalker they control.

cards.name: Chandra's Outburst
cards.text:
Chandra's Outburst deals 4 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Search your library and/or graveyard for a card named Chandra, Bold Pyromancer, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you search your library this way, shuffle it.

cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, they don't bite. They much prefer setting people on fire."
—Jaya Ballard, to Chandra
cards.name: Karplusan Hound
cards.text: Whenever Karplusan Hound attacks, if you control a Chandra planeswalker, this creature deals 2 damage to any target.

cards.flavor: "From the volcanoes of Shiv to the Balduvian steppes, I have sought a worthy teacher. At last, I have found one."
cards.name: Pyromantic Pilgrim
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor: Glaciers, torrential floods, and temporal disturbances came and went. The mountains yet stood, unchanged.
cards.name: Timber Gorge
cards.text:
Timber Gorge enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.

cards.flavor: The peaks of Hurloon never fall silent.
cards.name: Firesong and Sunspeaker
cards.text:
Red instant and sorcery spells you control have lifelink.
Whenever a white instant or sorcery spell causes you to gain life, Firesong and Sunspeaker deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
